title: FTN fetcher not retrieving full subscriber content
description:
The fetch_ftn_clean.py script is not properly fetching the full subscriber content from Fix The News. The downloaded HTML files (e.g., FTN-315.html) only contain 118 lines and show 'You're reading the free version of Fix The News' message.

Current behavior:
- Files end abruptly with Firefox reader mode UI controls
- Content stops at 'For paid subscribers this week:' with bullet points but no actual subscriber content
- Appears to be truncated or captured before full content loads

Possible causes:
1. Reader mode (about:reader?url=...) may activate before subscriber content fully loads
2. Reader mode may be stripping out subscriber-specific content
3. Authentication cookies may not be properly passed to reader mode
4. Wait times may be insufficient for full page load

Investigation needed:
- Test fetch without reader mode to see if full content is available
- Increase wait times before activating reader mode
- Verify authentication status on the page before reader mode
- Consider alternative approaches to clean HTML extraction

Related files:
- code/src/fetch_ftn_clean.py (lines 90-100: reader mode activation)
- data/ftn/FTN-315.html (truncated output)

title: Verify FTN /latest URL pattern still uses -d suffix for free preview
description: On Oct 22, 2025, we discovered that /latest redirects to a public preview URL ending in -dNN (e.g., -d49) even for logged-in users. The fetch script now strips this suffix to access the paid version. We need to verify this pattern is consistent with the next issue (expected Thu Oct 23 or 24). Test: 1) Navigate to fixthenews.com/latest while logged in, 2) Check if URL has -d suffix, 3) Manually remove suffix and verify paid content loads, 4) Update fetch_ftn_clean.py if pattern changes.

title: Parser repeats headline as first sentence in article content
description: The FTN parser (_create_story_from_reader in src/parser.py) was extracting the title from the first sentence but not removing it from the content, causing headlines to repeat as the first sentence of each article. Fixed by removing the title from content after extraction (line 195). Verified fix in ftn-315.json.

title: Implement rotating taglines for newspaper masthead
description:

- 'The News You're Not Hearing.'

Also consider making 'Quick Win' content rotate or be theme-specific (currently has hardcoded fallback text in templates/newspaper.html:58)

Location: templates/newspaper.html:15

title: Pull URLs from Google Sheet for additional summaries
notes:
Fetch URLs from a Google Sheet for local news summaries. User will manually populate sheet with links from various sources.

Requirements:
- Read URLs from Google Sheet (Google Sheets API integration)
- Support multiple news sources (not just FTN)
- Handle authentication for paywalled sources
- Extend fetch_ftn_clean.py approach to generic URL fetcher
- Store credentials securely (consider using playwright persistent contexts per source)

Architecture considerations:
- Generic fetcher base class
- Source-specific fetchers (inherit from base)
- Cookie/session management per source
- Sheet structure: URL, source_type, category, date_added

This will enable pulling in hand-curated local news alongside FTN content.

title: Generate tomorrow teaser content automatically
Build CLI UI for story/stat/content selection
notes:
Interactive CLI UI for curating newspaper content. Requires significant brainstorming and design work.

Current workflow pain points:
- All stories/stats auto-generated or from JSON
- No way to manually select/reject stories
- No preview before final PDF
- Cannot tweak individual elements

Proposed workflow:
1. Fetch/generate candidate content (FTN + Google Sheet URLs)
2. Show interactive selection UI
3. User picks main story, mini articles, stats
4. Preview before generating final PDF
5. Save selections for reproducibility

UI considerations:
- Library: inquirer, questionary, or rich + textual
- Need to show: title, first paragraph, source
- Multi-select for mini articles
- Single-select for main story
- Inline editing for headlines/stats?
- PDF preview integration?

This is a major UX improvement - needs design thinking before implementation.
Priority 1 because it's blocking full manual curation workflow.

title: Add 'combine stories' feature to curation TUI
notes:
Allow combining 2+ related stories into a single merged story during curation. When stories cover similar topics, user can select multiple stories and merge them into one combined story with concatenated content. Useful for related news that would work better as a single mini article.

Design considerations:
- Add [C] Combine option to day review menu
- Prompt for story numbers to combine (e.g., '2,3,5')
- Merge title+content from all selected stories
- Generate new tui_headline for combined story
- Keep as mini article (not main)
- Remove source stories from day
- Track in changes_made log

Example workflow:
Day 2 has stories about solar panels (story 2) and battery storage (story 3)
User types 'c' -> '2,3' -> Combined into single mini article about renewable energy storage

title: Remove or fix 'Quick Win' box - currently shows same placeholder text
design:
The 'Quick Win' feature box on the front page currently shows the same hardcoded placeholder text every day. This defeats the purpose of highlighting daily wins.

Options:
1. Remove it entirely (simplest)
2. Make it rotate by day/theme
3. Auto-generate from story content
4. Pull from curated list of quick wins
5. Leave empty unless manually specified

Current location: templates/newspaper.html (feature box section)

Related to DailyNews-18 (rotating taglines) - both are static content that should be dynamic.

Decision needed: What should 'Quick Win' actually be? If we can't make it meaningfully different each day, better to remove it than show stale content.

title: Fill blank space on front page with additional content
design:
Front page has significant white space that could be filled with more content. Currently only has main story and feature box.

Potential content to add:
- Additional mini articles (2-3 short stories)
- Photo/illustration placeholders
- Quote of the day
- This day in history
- Local news briefs (from Google Sheets)
- Weekly weather summary
- Calendar highlights

Likely blocked by:
- DailyNews-19 (Google Sheets integration) - needed for local news content
- DailyNews-5 (news highlight feature boxes) - structured content blocks
- DailyNews-4 (family calendar) - personal calendar integration

Design considerations:
- Must maintain print-friendly black & white aesthetic
- Cannot overflow to page 3 (strict 2-page limit)
- Should complement main story, not compete with it
- Need to balance content density with readability

Next steps:
1. Measure actual white space available
2. Design mock-ups with different content layouts
3. Determine which content sources are feasible
4. Implement after DailyNews-19 provides additional content pipeline
